meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Chenopodium, typically with triangular leaves resembling the foot of a goose.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted some goosefoots in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw a field full of goosefoots on my walk.
meanings.sent3: The geese were confused by the goosefoots growing near their pond.
meanings.sent4: The goosefoots in the meadow danced in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The herbalist carefully harvested the goosefoots for their medicinal properties.

meanings.sent1: She collected a bunch of goosefoots for her science project.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various goosefoots from around the world.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled at the word 'goosefoots' during the spelling bee.
meanings.sent4: The shelves were filled with jars of goosefoots in the pantry.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful picture of the goosefoots in the field.
